strings.Value: "Don't be so hard on yourself. You've been through a lot. Of course it left some scars."
[Pull away] "Since you brought it up… It's true — I've already endured this for too long. I can't any more. It's better if we put an end to this."
[Hold Octavia] "We both have old wounds, and we're both insane in our own ways. How would we survive if we didn't support each other?"
[Hold Octavia] "I love you. And I will never leave you."
[Pull away] "It's true — if you keep doing this, at some point I might not be able to take it."

{n}Octavia is unusually sad and quiet today. She stares down at the ground, then looks up at you.{/n} "{Name}... How can you stand me? I just keep hurting you. I'm an egotistical fool who can't turn away from her own troubles for a moment and think about someone else's."
"And you're still with me. In spite of it all... I don't know how. I wouldn't have put up with myself. I'd have thrown me away."

{n}Holding you tight, Octavia sniffs.{/n} "Yes... But I've relied on your support for such a long time, giving so little in return... I won't ever forget that I'm not the only one who can be hurt and tired."
{n}Octavia wipes a tear.{/n} "Yes... Yes, I'll remember. I'm sorry."
{n}Holding you tight, Octavia sniffs.{/n} "Thank you. Thank you for not leaving me. Even if I deserve it."
"Thank you for understanding. But it's wrong! Why do I take revenge on those I love, for the harm that my enemies did to me?"

"All these tests, trying to make you jealous, suddenly blurting out something rude... The more I've fallen in love with you, the more I've pushed you away, because I was afraid to become your prisoner. But what would I do if you really left?"
